title: CORS application configuration seems broken/not working as expected

labels.name: triage/needs-reproducer
labels.description: We are waiting for a reproducer.

body:
### Describe the bug

Since version 2.16 the CORS configuration has changed. However, even when applying the configuration proposed in the official migration guide (which should result in the exact behaviour as before 2.16) or manually configuring origins URLs requests from the client will not go through.
```
quarkus:
  http:
    cors:
      origins: /.*/
```


### Expected behavior

Request from the client should go through.

### Actual behavior

Following CORS error is presented on the client side.

```
Access to fetch at 'http://localhost:8080/<resource-path>' from origin 'http://localhost:<port>' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.
```
